metadata.title: "Coyote's Journey"
metadata.author: Nettie Reuben
metadata.publication: William Bright, The Karok Language (1957), p. 162-167, Text 1
metadata.note: Sentences 119 through 132 were added by the informant at a later date.

s.txt:
káan
áraar
ú krii ,
táay
vúra
mu pathúvriin .
s.trans: A person lived there, he had a lot of strings of money.

s.txt:
káan
pihnêefich
u máah tih ,
t óo
mah
p oo pathuvrîina ti
ára
kaan .
s.trans: Coyote saw him there, he saw the person there measuring strings of money.

s.txt:
kári
xás
u piip , "
hôoy
i máah ti
p eeshpuk ."
s.trans: And he said, "Where do you find the money?"

s.txt:
kári
xás
u piip , "
kahyúras ."
s.trans: And he said, "At Klamath Lakes."

s.txt:
kári
xás
pihnêefich
xás
u pvâaram .
s.trans: So Coyote went home then.

s.txt:
kári
xás
u xú tih , "
tîi
kan paríshriihv i .
s.trans: And he thought, "Let me twine string!

s.txt:
xasík
kahyúras
ni vâaram i .
s.trans: Let me go to Klamath Lakes!
s.note: Use of ni- with imperative verb unexpected. Note all the other imperatives in the text which use kan- and the lack of any TAM particle in this sentence,so the imperative -i might be a speech error

s.txt:
vaa
p eeshpúk
ni kyâar eesh ,
íf
tá
ni tápkuup ."
s.trans: I will go get that money, I have really taken a liking to it."

s.txt:
xás
vaa
táay
t u paríshriihva
pá 'aan .
s.trans: So he twined a lot of string.

s.txt:
ta'ítam
u kífukv aheen
pá 'aan .
s.trans: Then he tied the string in a bundle.

s.txt:
kári
xás
u xus , "
chími
kan 'arámsiiprin i ."
s.trans: And he thought, "Let me start out!"

s.txt:
kári
xás
u 'árihroov ,
áan
ithá 'iithva ,
an tunvêech ,
vaa
p oo vúpar eesh
p eeshpuk .
s.trans: And he went upriver; the string was in a single pack, the little string, that which he was going to string the money with.

s.txt:
víri
vaa
pa t óo
thvásip
t óo
thvároov
pá 'aan .
s.trans: When he had packed it up, he carried the string upriver.

s.txt:
chavúra
yíiv
káruk
t u 'áhoo .
s.trans: Finally he walked a long ways upriver.

s.txt:
xás
íshaha
t óo
xrah .
s.trans: And he got thirsty.

s.txt:
"
vúra
pu na 'ísh eesh ara ."
s.trans: "I won't drink."

s.txt:
púyava
t óo
mah
pa saamvároo .
s.trans: Then he saw the creek.

s.txt:
xás
kári
t oo
xus , "
pu na 'ísh eesh ara ."
s.trans: And he thought, "I won't drink."

s.txt:
vúra
vaa
u 'áhoo tih .
s.trans: He was traveling like that.

s.txt:
xás
chavúra
yíiv
káruk
t u 'áhoo .
s.trans: And finally he traveled a long ways upriver.

s.txt:
vúra
t óo
xra
pa 'íshaha .
s.trans: He really got thirsty.
s.note: Bright writes "xrah" with an unexpected h. Since he admits to placing the h's based on his final-h deletion rule and not based on hearing them, we assume the h he writes in this sentence is a mistake.

s.txt:
vúra
vaa
t oo
xus , "
pu na 'ísh eesh ara ,
naa
ishpúk
ni kyâan tih ."
s.trans: He thought like that, "I won't drink, I'm going to get money."

s.txt:
kári
xás
chavúra
t óo
xrah ,
vúra
t óo
xra
pa 'íshaha .
s.trans: And finally he got thirsty, he really got thirsty.

s.txt:
kári
xás
u xus , "
payêem
vúra
ni 'ísh eesh
pa saamvároo
ni mah aak ."
s.trans: And he thought, "Now I'll drink when I see a creek.

s.txt:
kári
xás
púyava
chavúra
yíiv
t u 'áhoo .
s.trans: And so finally he traveled a long ways.

s.txt:
vúra
tá
kâarim ,
t óo
xra
íshaha .
s.trans: He was really bad off, he was thirsty.

s.txt:
kári
xás
yánava
pa 'íshaha ,
pa saamvároo
ú xaak tih .
s.trans: Then he saw the water, the creek was sounding.

s.txt:
t oo
xus , "
ni 'ísh eesh
pa káan
ni 'uum áhaak ."
s.trans: He thought, "I'll drink when I get there."

s.txt:
kári
xás
p oo 'úum
yánava
t u pivaxráh een
pa saamvároo .
s.trans: And when he arrived he saw the creek had dried up.

s.txt:
kári
xás "
ii !
púya
íf
íshaha
tá
née xrah ."
s.trans: "Oh, how thirsty I am!"

s.txt:
kári
xás
u xus , "
vúra
tá
íiv
ni máhavrik ."
s.trans: And he thought, "I can't stand it."

s.txt:
t óo
xra
pa 'íshaha ,
vúra
t u váxrah .
s.trans: He was thirsty, he was so dry.

s.txt:
kári
xás
u thítiv ,
ú xaak tih ,
pa 'íshaha
ú xaak tih .
s.trans: Then he heard it, it was sounding, the water was sounding.

s.txt:
kári
xás
u chunvákir
pa 'íshaha .
s.trans: And he sneaked up on the water.

s.txt:
kári
xás
ûumukich
t u 'uum .
s.trans: And he got close.

s.txt:
vúra
vaa
u thítiim tih ,
ú xaak tih
pa 'íshaha
pa t u chunvákir .
s.trans: He heard it that way, the water was sounding as he sneaked up.

s.txt:
xás
t óo
mah
pa 'íshaha
p oo vúun tih .
s.trans: And he saw the water flowing.
He got real close.

s.txt:
kári
xás
u kvíripship ,
káan
u 'uum .
s.trans: Then he broke into a run, he arrived there.

s.txt:
yánava
t u pivaxráh een .
s.trans: He saw it had dried up.

s.txt:
kári
xás
u xus , "
púya
íf
tá
née xrah ."
s.trans: And he thought, "How thirsty I am!"

s.txt:
vúra
tá
kâarim .
s.trans: He was really bad off.

s.txt:
vúra
vaa
u 'áhoo tih ,
vúra
tá
yíiv
káruk .
s.trans: He was walking that way, a long ways upriver by this time.

s.txt:
sáruk
t óo
tfáku tih .
s.trans: He looked downhill.

s.txt:
sáruk
p eeshkêesh
u vuunvárak tih .
s.trans: Downhill the river was flowing downriverward.

s.txt:
xás
u xus , "
kíri
páy
kári
vaa
ni 'ish ."
s.trans: And he thought, "I wish I could drink that."

s.txt:
kári
xás
ee !
vúra
vaa
u 'áhoo tih ,
vúra
tá
kâarim .
s.trans: And oh! he was walking that way, he was really bad off.

s.txt:
vúra
chími
u 'uum êesh
kahyúras .
s.trans: He was about to get to Klamath Lakes.

s.txt:
kári
xás
yánava
yíiv
káruk
t u 'áhoo .
s.trans: He saw he was a long ways upriver.

s.txt:
kári
xás
yánava
kúkuum
káan
íshaha
ú xaak tih ,
u saamvároo hi tih .
s.trans: And he saw again the water sounding there, there was a creek.

s.txt:
kári
xás
kúkuum
t oo
xus , "
hôoy
íf
ni 'uum êesh ."
s.trans: And again he thought, "I can't reach it."

s.txt:
kóova
íshaha
t óo
xrah .
s.trans: He was so thirsty.

s.txt:
kári
xás
kúkuum
u chunvákir
pa saamvároo .
s.trans: And again he sneaked up on the creek.

s.txt:
kêech ,
saamvaróo kaam .
s.trans: It was big, a big creek.

s.txt:
xás
u xus , "
tîi
kúuk
kan íkfuukm i ."
s.trans: And he thought, "Let me crawl to it."

s.txt:
kári
xás
pa mú vaas
u pishnákarishuk .
s.trans: And he undid his blanket.

s.txt:
kári
xás
ta'ítam
páy
u nísh aheen .
s.trans: And he did this with it (wadded it up, shown by informant's gestures.)

s.txt:
xás
ú muus tih ,
vúra
uum
táay
pa 'íshaha ,
vúra
ûumukich .
s.trans: And he looked; there was a lot of water, just close.

s.txt:
kári
xás
u kvíripship .
s.trans: And he broke into a run.

s.txt:
xás
kúuk
u páathma
pa mú vaas .
s.trans: And he threw his blanket at it.

s.txt:
ámtaap
kích
u thívpup .
s.trans: Just dust puffed up.

s.txt:
t u piváxra
pa 'íshaha .
s.trans: The water had dried up.

s.txt:
kári
xás
u xus , "
ii !
vúra
tá
pu ná 'uum ara ,
vúra
íshaha
tá
née xrah ."
s.trans: And he thought, "Oh, I can't reach it, I'm really thirsty."

s.txt:
kári
xás
sáruk
t óo
tfáku tih .
s.trans: And he looked away downhill.

s.txt:
vúra
vaa
sáruk
u vuunvárak tih
p eeshkéesh .
s.trans: Downhill the river was flowing downriverward like that.

s.txt:
ii !
xás
u xus , "
chími
vaa
kan 'îish i
p eeshkéesh ."
s.trans: Oh, he thought, "Let me drink from the river!"

s.txt:
ta'ítam
sáruk
u 'árihfak aheen .
s.trans: So he went downhill.

s.txt:
xás
u xus , "
púya
íf
kâarim
tá
ni kúupha ,
pa chími
ísh eesh .
s.trans: And he thought, "How bad I do, being about to drink water.

s.txt:
káruma
kahyúras
ishpúk
ni kyâan tih ."
s.trans: I'm going to get money at Klamath Lakes."

s.txt:
xás
astíip
u vîish .
s.trans: So he went down to the bank.

s.txt:
xás
úuth
u tkára tih .
s.trans: And he looked out to the water.

s.txt:
xás
u xus , "
vúra
pu na 'ísh eesh ara
astíip ich ."
s.trans: And he thought, "I won't drink right by the bank."

s.txt:
kári
xás
u piip , "
chími
ikúrinishrih i
itháriip ."
s.trans: And he said, "Fall down, fir tree!"

s.txt:
t óo
kúrinishrih .
s.trans: (One) fell down.

s.txt:
xás
u vátakar .
s.trans: And he walked out into the river on it.

s.txt:
kári
xás
ishkéesh 'aachip
u 'uum .
s.trans: And he got to the middle of the river.

s.txt:
kári
xás
ta'ítam
u kúkurih een .
s.trans: And then he stooped down to the water.

s.txt:
vúra
uum
xára
p oo kúkuri
pa 'íshaha ,
t u 'ísh
taay .
s.trans: He stooped down to the water for a long time, he drank a lot.

s.txt:
kári
xás
p oo p vôonsip
taay
t u 'ish .
s.trans: And when he got up, he had drunk a lot.

s.txt:
víri
vaa
vúra
u pikyívivraa .
s.trans: So he fell over.

s.txt:
vásihkam
úuth
ú kyiimkar .
s.trans: He fell backwards into the river.

s.txt:
kári
xás
yúruk
u thívruuhrup .
s.trans: And he floated downriverward.

s.txt:
chavúra
tá
yíiv
t óo
p thívruuhvarak .
s.trans: Finally he floated a long ways downriver back to here.

s.txt:
chavúra
ôok
ithivthaanéen 'aachip
t óo
p thívruuhvarak .
s.trans: Finally he floated back downriver here to the center of the world.

s.txt:
kári
xás
yúruk
u trûupu tih .
s.trans: And he looked downriver.

s.txt:
yánava
yúruk
ifápiit sha
kun tákiri ti
astiip .
s.trans: He saw young women leaching on the bank downriver.

s.txt:
kári
xás
u piip , "
sah'ahup yâamach
kan párihish ."
s.trans: And he said, "Let me turn into a pretty piece of driftwood!"

s.txt:
kári
xás
sah'ahup yâamach
vaa
u párihish .
s.trans: And he turned into a pretty piece of driftwood.

s.txt:
kári
xás
u thívruuhvarak .
s.trans: And he floated down from upriver.

s.txt:
ûumukich
vúra
t óo
muus tih
pa kun tákiri tih .
s.trans: Nearby he looked at them leaching.

s.txt:
xás
u piip , "
astíip ich
vúra
kan thivrúh i ,
astíip ich
vúra
kan thivrúh i .
s.trans: And he said, "Let me float to the bank, let me float to the bank.

s.txt:
mukun sá'kukam ich
xasík
ni p thivrúh roon eesh ."
s.trans: I will keep floating back upriver just downhill from them.

s.txt:
kári
xás
pa 'ifápiit
sáruk
úuth
u tkára tih .
s.trans: And the girl looked downhill into the river.

s.txt:
xás
u piip , "
yáxa ,
éev .
s.trans: And she said, "Look, dear.
s.note: Bright: "éev (basic form êev), here translated "dear," is a term of address used by women to relatives or intimate friends."

s.txt:
oo !
yáxa
kóo
yâamach
sâam
pa sah'áhup ."
s.trans: Oh, look at what a pretty piece of driftwood downhill!"

s.txt:
xás
yítha
u piip , "
hôoy ."
s.trans: And (the other) one said, "Where?"

s.txt:
xás
u piip , "
máva
sâam ."
s.trans: And she said, "There downhill."

s.txt:
xás
u piip , "
oo !
êev ,
chími
nú taatripaa
pa sah'áhup ."
s.trans: And (the other) said, "Oh, dear, let's hook the driftwood out!"

s.txt:
"
chémi ."
s.trans: "All right."

s.txt:
ta'ítam
sâam
kun ithvíripunih .
s.trans: So they ran downhill.

s.txt:
tá
kun imúsar
p oo p thivrúh roona tih .
s.trans: They went to look at it floating back upriver.

s.txt:
xás
u piip , "
chími ,
êev ,
hôoy
kích
ahúp'anamahach .
s.trans: And (one) said, "Come on, dear, where is a little stick?

s.txt:
vaa
mûuk
nu tâatripaa vish ."
s.trans: We'll hook it out with that."

s.txt:
xás
ta'ítam
kun tâatripaa heen .
s.trans: And so they hooked it out.

s.txt:
xás
oo !
tá
kun tápkuup .
s.trans: And oh, they took a liking to it!

s.txt:
oo !
púya
íf
yâamachich
pa sah'áhup ,
tá
kun tápkuup .
s.trans: Oh, how pretty the driftwood was, they took a liking to it.

s.txt:
kári
xás
kúuk
u páathma
yítha ,
tá
kun íxtiivhar
vaa
pa sah'áhup .
s.trans: And one threw it to (another), they played with that driftwood.

s.txt:
yâamachich
pa 'ahúp'anamahach .
s.trans: The little stick was pretty.

s.txt:
kári
xás
yítha
u píip
pa 'ifápiit , "
ããx !"
u piip , "
ããx !
atafâat
pihnêefich .
s.trans: Then one girl said, "Ugh!" she said, "ugh! maybe it's Coyote.

s.txt:
mít
kun íp aat '
káruk
úuth
t u 'íimkar .'"
s.trans: They said he drowned in the river upriver."

s.txt:
kári
xás
úuth
kun pí paathkar
pa sah'áhup .
s.trans: And they threw the driftwood back in the river.

s.txt:
kári
xás
tá
kun 'akíthkith
pa mukún xuun ,
pa mukun tákir .
s.trans: And they took up their acorn soup, their leaching.

s.txt:
cháva
tá
xánahishich
yánava
xákaan
vúra
tá
kun ímuutara ha .
s.trans: Sure enough, in a little while they saw they were both pregnant.

s.txt:
pihnêefich
y óo
kpuuhrup ,
kuyûum
xás
u kpúhish .
s.trans: Coyote floated downriver, he swam ashore downriver from them then.

s.txt:
púyava
páy
pihnêefich
u kúphaa nik .
s.trans: So Coyote did that.

s.txt:
u p ipshinvárihva
p eeshpúk
káruk
u kyâan tih .
s.trans: He forgot that he was going upriver to get money.

s.txt: kupánakanakana .
s.trans: Kupánakanakana.

s.txt:
pihnêefich
u kúphaa nik .
s.trans: Coyote did it.

s.txt:
pa 'úuth
kun pí paathkar
thúfip
xás
u thivrúhish .
s.trans: When they threw him back in the river, he then floated ashore at Requa.

s.txt:
xás
vúra va
káan
u tháaniv
astiip .
s.trans: And he lay there on the bank.

s.txt:
kári
xás
pâanpay
pishpishih 'îin
tá
kun 'av .
s.trans: And after a while the yellowjackets ate him.

s.txt:
xás
vúra
vaa
u tháaniv .
s.trans: And he lay there like that.

s.txt:
chufniivkach 'îin
káru
vúra
pa tá
kun 'av .
s.trans: Flies ate him too.

s.txt:
chími
vúra
p aasvut 'îin
káru
pa tá
kun 'av .
s.trans: Soon the ants ate him too.

s.txt:
vúra
vaa
u tháaniv .
s.trans: He lay there like that.

s.txt:
kári
xás
víri
tá
ípi
vúra ,
pa mu 'ípi
kích
u tháaniv .
s.trans: And there were just bones by now, only his bones lay there.

s.txt:
xás
kári
vúra
vaa
u tháaniv .
s.trans: And still he lay there like that.

s.txt:
xás
kári
vaa
vúra
kích
káan
u 'iish hí ti
vuutrava'áfiv .
s.trans: And there was still meat there in his testicles.
s.note: In Bright, there is a paragraph break in the English between this sentence and the previous one, but there is no corresponding break in the Karuk. As you can see, I have kept the break here.

s.txt:
kári
xás
pa pishpíshi
u xus , "
tîi
páy
kan 'am .
s.trans: And the yellowjacket thought, "Let me eat this."

s.txt:
kári
xás
vaa
u 'áv
káan
pá 'iish .
s.trans: And so he ate the meat there.

s.txt:
kári
xás
p óo par ,
kári
xás
u 'árihship
pihnêefich .
s.trans: And when he bit it, then Coyote jumped up.

s.txt:
xás
u piip , "
atutututututu !"
s.trans: And he said, "atutututututu!"

s.txt:
kári
xás
áhup
u 'ûusip .
s.trans: And he picked up a stick.

s.txt:
kári
xás
u 'ákoo naa .
s.trans: And he hit them.

s.txt:
púyava
vaa
u kúphaa nik
pihnêefich .
s.trans: So Coyote did that.

s.txt:
xás
u mthavitrûuprihva .
s.trans: He almost clubbed through them.

s.txt:
víri
vaa
kumá'ii
koovúra
pa tûupichas
pa mu sxíchak .
s.trans: So that's why they all have small waists.
